lines.line: The dusk was black although, elsewhere, the first star in the cold
And I thought I heard the fresh scraping of the flying steel of boys
And I thought I heard the dusk and silence raided
By a calm voice commanding consciousness:

Wait: wait: wait as if you had always waited And as if it had always been dark And as if the world had been from the beginning A lost and drunken ark in which the only light Was the dread and white of the terrified animals’ eyes.
And then, turning on the light, I took a book
That I might gaze upon another’s vision of the abyss of conscious-
